FacilityName: AGRIServices of Brunswick, LLC. - Brunswick East

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan - Executive Summary



Facility:    AGRIServices of Brunswick, LLC - East

Location:    1010 E. Broadway, Brunswick, Mo.

Contact:     Sara Stockwell

Phone:     660-548-3177





1. The Facility Policy



The employees of the AGRIServices of Brunswick, LLC - East in Brunswick are committed to the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the Brunswick Fire Department, and other authorities, to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.



2. Facility Information



The primary activity at the facility is the receiving, storage and distribution of bulk dry and liquid fertilizer and anhydrous ammonia for direct application as a crop nutrient. The facility also handles pesticides, grain, feed and farm supply products.



3. The Accidental Release Prevention Program.



The facility has implemented the provisions of "Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, K-61.1, 1999", published by The American National Standards Institute, Inc., the Missouri Anhydrous Ammonia Law and the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and handling of Anhydrous Ammonia".



4. The Five-year Accident History



There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that: have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge, have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.



5. The Emergency Response Program.



The facility has;



    a. a written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA Standard, 29 CFR 1910.38;



    b. provided State and Local authorities with the emergency planning and community 

        right-to-know information as required under SARA Title III (EPCRA);



    c. a written emergency respo

nse program, in accordance with OSHA Standard, 29 CFR 

        1910.120, including pre-emergency planning and employee training.



6. Planned changes to improve safety.



Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility. Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the maintenance of safe conditions. The facility will be periodically reviewed and upgrades will be made to meet the most current K61.1 ANSI Code as time and budgets allow.





    7/15/13
